website_summaries.verdict: With better performance and photo quality than the 70D, the Canon EOS 80D is worth the upgrade, but it's got a lot of competition for the money.
pros: The Canon EOS 80D is fast, and if you play with the settings can produce excellent photo and video quality
cons: The automatic white balance isn't very good, and it doesn't have a terribly broad set of features

website_summaries.verdict: The Canon EOS 80D offers some significant upgrades over its predecessor, and is a strong performer in the midrange SLR space.

customer_reviews.title: Buy this and enjoy a super camera.
customer_reviews.text: I moved from a compact to the Canon Powershot SX50HS about 4 years ago and now I wanted to upgrade again and I am really pleased with this camera. The build quality is good and the picture quality is superb. I was concerned it might be a complex piece of kit but its well thought out and easy to get away from Auto mode and into more interesting shooting modes.
customer_reviews.author: Barrie

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic camera
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from the eos 100d and boy is it an upgrade. It has a load of great features from the increase AF points to the auto spirit level (WiFi is nice but not really needed)... the only downside is the weight when compared to the 100d, a lot heavier (but as guy I believe heavy means good)....wouldn’t recommend it as your first DSLR but certainly something to upgrade to.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: It's a superb camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera because I found that my Full frame (EOS5D mk3) camera was just too heavy. The *80D has a similar focussing system to the 5D which I found to be excellent for Birds in flight. Although Canon has marketed several new models since the launch of the 80D, this is still a very good option and at an excellent price.
customer_reviews.author: stanley

customer_reviews.title: A Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: I have had this camera almost 6 months now and still learning to use it to its full potential. Its predecessor was a Canon T3i 600D which was pretty good for learning and I transferred much of the knowledge to the 80D so I had a good basic understanding but the 80D goes much further, more facilities and more 'power'. The supplied downloadable manual is very comprehensive but a little sparing on detail so I have made use of You Tube quite a bit. On the whole I am very happy with my purchase and am now in the process of acquiring some better lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Goldsmith

customer_reviews.title: The Best Camera So Far That I've Owned
customer_reviews.text: Wow, Just Wow this camera is perfect. I'm not a professional I'm an amateur who wanted to upgrade from a non-DLSR. This camera takes some fantastic pictures with minimal effort using the Auto function. I'm now getting used to this camera, and I've started to experiment with manual settings. The key things that stand out for me are:- Interchangeable lens Awesome Video auto function Decent battery life Great screen that's able to flip so if you are looking at the camera head-on you can see if you are in the shot. What I don't like:- Weight if travelling that's it, one very, very good camera perfect for pictures but also excellent for video.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: It deserves to be called a Canon camera.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best DSLR I have ever had. Very good quality and easy to use. Very intuitive menu and Wi-Fi + GPS give it a PLUS. Movies recorded and picture taken with this camera have professional quality. It deserves the name Canon on it.
customer_reviews.author: PsFabio

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Only used a little since I got this - moved up from a D100 so a big step - this looks to be a camera that warrants the hype and appears to be every bit as good as the review say. Looking forward to a long and enjoyable ownership experience, especially when I've saved the pennies to buy some proper lenses. So far its very good even on modest "kit" lenses
customer_reviews.author: Tom O'Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Enjoying the wifi and remote shooting from my iMac, can change settings, record video, take pics, change focus, all with a mouse! Besides that, when used with STM lens the autofocus is brilliant, pull focus shots are super easy using the flip touchscreen.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with it
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with it. Purchased before going to Australia and I couldn't fault it. I haven't even used all it's facilities, but it's a great camera so far.
customer_reviews.author: Nigel Hefford

customer_reviews.title: ... with its high ISO and also its speed is great for movement
customer_reviews.text: This camera makes low light photography more effective with its high ISO and also its speed is great for movement. The fold out touchscreen is brilliant. You can either have it out to use live view for shooting movies or it folds into the back of the camera functioning as an info screen where you can change settings very fast with a finger touch. as I only just have it I can't say more than that but so far so very good.
customer_reviews.author: Gill Turney

customer_reviews.title: Great camera... with latest tech functionalities.. professional quality photos
customer_reviews.text: I love the camera. Works like a beast... professional quality photos... Latest tech (Wi-Fi, touch screen) and features.... However, the kit lens isn't very ideal for professional work. You would need another APSC lens .... for video the Sigma 17 - 50mm f2.8 is highly recommended All at an Awesome price.
customer_reviews.author: Sampa FM

customer_reviews.title: Buy this camera!
customer_reviews.text: As the photo industry is beginning to realise too many pixels can confuse the electrons in the adjacent ones and cause noise (graininess). This camera has got it just right for the price. 12 out of 10 canon!
customer_reviews.author: Dr Alan Kirkpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. Disapointed the instructions are in Chinese and the charger is of nu use. The charger only fits with a adapter for the mains, is it has 2 pins. Very disappointed I have had to pay over £800.00 and the charger and manual are not UK compatible. I have been in touch with the supplier, and hope they can send me a English manual and charger
customer_reviews.author: Midas Adventure Activities

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I’m over the moon with this camera, I upgraded from a canon 400d and the difference it’s amazing. I was a bit worried as it’s a bit bigger and heavier than my previous camera but as soon as I started using it I completely forgot about it.
customer_reviews.author: Paula V

customer_reviews.title: enjoying this replacement for my 50D
customer_reviews.text: good feel, not too heavy. video is very clear (unfortunately not 4K) but really needs a gimbal. AF systems takes a bit of getting used to. works well with Tamron 18-400. yet to use with my Canon 70-200.
customer_reviews.author: sleepypete

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: It’s at home eating dust while I take my iPhone 8 on holiday. Can’t spot difference after upgrading from canon 60d.
customer_reviews.author: N. Tavo

customer_reviews.title: It broke within a year after purchase.
customer_reviews.text: After take excellent care of my canon 80D, the external microphone port has gone fault so that it does not allow me to use my external microphone with the camera. The repair for such a fault is costly. I have contacted the seller to received and invoice in hope that it will be repaired by canon for free; as it broke after a year of purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Divakaran

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit apprehensive about this camera and getting used to all the settings and controls, but it is all so intuitive with everything in the right place to make full control very easy. Awesome camera with awesome photos and videos
customer_reviews.author: Ian Pritchard

customer_reviews.title: Top camera
customer_reviews.text: Great camera even better than I thought it would be can't wait for summer and get out and take more pictures
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT recommend this product or the seller
customer_reviews.text: Bought the canon 80d have had for around 9 months but very lightly used and the flash now does not work at all. Will have to send back to canon for repair under warranty however not what you expect from this brand or price point. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Mr John Welsh

customer_reviews.title: Poor Focus & Sharpness
customer_reviews.text: I have to say I'm disappointed with both the focus and sharpness of this camera. Easy to use, but quality of Photos not good. I'm going to replace with a better Body.
customer_reviews.author: IGRS

customer_reviews.title: An excellent mid range DSLR
customer_reviews.text: Great improvement over my existing Canon EOS 500D with better autofocus and full HD movie capability
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: great camera from canon
customer_reviews.text: great camera from canon, resolution is superb and low vibration from mirror Only niggle is the strap supplied is scratchy and uncomfortable - replaced by neoprene one
customer_reviews.author: Richard S

customer_reviews.title: Good Camera
customer_reviews.text: Sorry for late reply, been so busy. Thank you for the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Keeley

customer_reviews.title: Canon 80D, it adds something different.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Canon 80D as my first DSLR and I'm over the moon with it. It's easy to use, great features... Can't wait to use it for pictures and videos.
customer_reviews.author: James P. Cruickshank

customer_reviews.title: This camera was made by a God.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic camera for advanced amateurs and anyone wanting to go a bit further with film making.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product by Canon
customer_reviews.text: its been 1 year the day i bought it from Amazon. no issues till now with the product. taking nice shots. will review based on the usage
customer_reviews.author: Gopinath

customer_reviews.title: Super DSLR
customer_reviews.text: Excellent mid range DSLR camera, not full frame but good enough for my needs. There are many, many features to get to grips with in order to get the most out of it. Canon seem to have discount periods throughout the year so worth looking for the best deal, although the discounts pale in significance once you start to add some quality lenses to cover a range of applications, then there are all the ancillary "must have" and "nice to have" items.
customer_reviews.author: tonyb

customer_reviews.title: Great! Upgraded from 1200D...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic camera. Upgraded from a 1200D and it's truly amazing! Everything is so much better.
customer_reviews.author: J Dooner

customer_reviews.title: Like this a lot but when looking for special offer ...
customer_reviews.text: Like this a lot but when looking for special offer from Canon ..."money back when you spend so much on a Canon product" I was told that I was not entitled to the offer because my Amazon bought product was not for distribution in the European market??? (Serial number)
customer_reviews.author: jo lock

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camera!
customer_reviews.text: I previously had a Canon 700d and fancied an upgrade. I love my 700d but theres a massive difference with this. The low light performance is outstanding, what a difference. I am extremely happy with the Canon 80d. The same handy flip out screen for the low or high shots is great. A nice little feature is the multiple exposure which I've been playing with, it might be a gimmick but I like it.
customer_reviews.author: mr m w hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Quality is amazing
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera! It takes some absolutely amazing shots, especially when you pair it with a 50mm lens!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Canon is the best manufacture of DSLR!
customer_reviews.text: Whats there to say? This is a fantastic product and brings me much joy!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan E

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is seriously epic! So glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera 80D
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera for keen amateur, which I am. Was an upgrade from 700D so was familiar with the layout. It is producing sharp pictures, and I am very happy with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Best cropped sensor so far by Canon
customer_reviews.text: So much more of features than expected - timelapse video, interval timer, multiexposure stills, hdr video and stills and usual AEB of course up to 7 images in one bracketing sequence. Continuous stills 7 pps with 20+ image buffer. Two own custom presets that sets camera into the mode you need regarding everything, apart from the creative and basic ones - just turn the knob to C1 or C2 mode. Released in 2016, this gives much more than 7D mk2 regarding so many things. Sensor is improved a lot, and even dark areas can be brightened up several stops afterwords without visible noise. Note, it needs fast U3 memory cards to do best quality video.
customer_reviews.author: Lars F.

customer_reviews.title: ... had a 40D for the past 8 years and loved it. The 80D feels lighter
customer_reviews.text: I have had a 40D for the past 8 years and loved it. The 80D feels lighter, deals with low light much better and the image quality overall is much improved. Time will tell how robust it is, but first impressions are very good.
customer_reviews.author: cjennings

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than buying direct from Cannon
customer_reviews.text: Nice size camera, great quality and not overly big or heavy. Very pleased with choosing this model. I bought a 50MM prime lens with it separately. Pictures are amazing
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looking for a mid-range DSLR for film and photography?  Buy this camera.
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best money I've ever spent. This camera packs one hell of a punch. Amazing focus for video and film, and very responsive for photography. The 45 points of AF are incredible for shooting video and keeping the target in focus, and the touch screen means you can alter the focus point on the fly, brilliant for cinematic shots. A massive ISO means it's great in most light conditions, and shooting at 60FPS makes for great viewing. Wireless and NFC for instant transfer to mobile devices is another brilliant feature, allowing you to upload that great shot in seconds. Looking for a mid-range DSLR for film and photography? Buy this camera.
customer_reviews.author: AJ Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Delighted
customer_reviews.text: Have used the cheaper eos 350D followed by a 450D before, those were good, this already is a much much better camera in every sense of the word from easy access menu's on the electronics to instant access buttons, shutter operation, spot metering..... Well worth the extra I have paid and a much more substantial camera.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am loving this, once I had found out ...
customer_reviews.text: I am loving this, once I had found out how to change the language from Chinese into English, superb weight of camera, and first results of the photos are pleasing. There are a lot of setting to change if you wish, but you can use as a point and shoot.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. K. A. Skipp

customer_reviews.title: Canon E O S 80 D
customer_reviews.text: I love my new Canon Camera. It was an upgrade from a entry level. Very happy good price arrived on time. What more can I say.
customer_reviews.author: margaret worton

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade to Canon EOS 80D from 70D.
customer_reviews.text: Improved on the 70D in quality of still photographs; sharper than with the 70D, although I was impressed by the 70D when I bought it - and still am (I've kept it as a backup as the 80D uses the lens and many other bits that I've bought). Noticeably better with the technically improved and more professional capability of the 80D when using the camera to take shots of subjects in motion in both still and video mode. The improvements to the various functions available are well worth while, and noticeable. The quibble about the lack of 4K doesn't bother me at all - I don't have a 4K television..! Overall, I am very pleased with the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. John Jones

customer_reviews.title: ... the Canon 80D on Amazon and I am very pleased with the service and the camera work fine
customer_reviews.text: I got the Canon 80D on Amazon and I am very pleased with the service and the camera work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Abel M'kulama

customer_reviews.title: ... a joke broken button doesn't work and cost me like £1000, what a seller
customer_reviews.text: what a joke broken button doesn't work and cost me like £1000, what a seller!
customer_reviews.author: Ray (TST)

customer_reviews.title: Really happy
customer_reviews.text: I did extensive research and was just not sure if I should get the Canon eos 200d, 800d or 80d, as I don't really need full frame, yet and just starting to really get into photography... I'm beyond happy that I decided to to buy this one... Have taken different pictures and was asked now to be the photographer on a birthday party. Really high quality and it's just fun to use... Was a bit concerned that it would be to heavy, but I don't really mind, I have to admit. I bought a lense for it and don't use the kit lens, so I would recommend to just get a body with a better lens.
customer_reviews.author: GV

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded from canon 1000d and absolutely love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from canon 1000d and absolutely love this camera. Photo quality is good, I really like touch and tilt screen, more auto focus options, but battery life is a little bit disappointing , my old canon 1000d still has longer battery life than 80d.
customer_reviews.author: ausra

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you’re getting a new camera.
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. If you’re buying this camera make sure you’re getting a new camera. The quality of the unit I got is good but after buying the camera putting a brand new card in, setting it up and taking it on a shoot, I dumped the files on my computer to find my image numbers starting at 600 plus. A quick check of my other cameras finds that with a brand new card installed the numbers start at 001, so I was sold a used unit for full price. Needless to say this was kind of a punch in the gut.
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a Beast!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE!! I was a little hesitant to go with a crop sensor but I absolutely love it! You just can't beat the face tracking, autofocus, plus photo capabilities! I've used a variety of lenses as well and had great results. Also came within 2 days with Prime shipping and I strongly recommend getting the Amazon Hard Drive with it!
customer_reviews.author: Alyx

customer_reviews.title: Good performing camera body
customer_reviews.text: So far, I'm really liking this body. I shoot a lot of wildlife and my dog with this camera. I'd prefer to have more frames / sec and so I strongly considered the Canon 7D Mark II which has a faster frame rate and reportedly faster focus, but the touch screen on this camera is a big bonus for me and a few other features. I'm getting great results. They brag about the 45 point focus system, but I've always found I get mediocre focus when I use anything but single point focus mode for action shots. Good performing camera. I'd make the same decision again for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Wynia

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Camera!!!
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a Rebel t4i and.. WoW.. I am seriously amazed at the quality of photographs that this thing can take. I didnt think that it could get much better but.. it is awesome. The depth of field is quite a upgrade. The new AF system is excellent at detecting faces and even in full auto mode it works great. I was going to get the D7 mark II but this is a newer camera, and might not be as good as the D7 in some respects, I am happy with getting this one.
customer_reviews.author: Aegiscrash

customer_reviews.title: Bought as used, still under Canon warranty and UNOPENED
customer_reviews.text: This is my new go-to body after destroying a 7D and finding the 6D Mark II complete rubbish. Seriously, this crop sensor body has more DR than a FF? Canon used the most sub-standard sensor (prob 5D rejects) they could in the 6D MkII..., avoid that POS at all costs. Anyway, this is about the 80D and it's a fine camera, not much more than the 70D, but a better processing engine and a few upgrades for those who don't have a 70D. If you have a 70D, this wouldn't be worth the "upgrade" to you, just subtle changes, nothing worth the cost of the "upgrade." If you want a do-it-all crop sensor camera, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: TRJ

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Upgrade from my Canon T4i. Still learning many of the features but the images are fantastic and it is easy to operate -- just different from my previous Rebel models. Would love to have jumped to a full frame model but just couldn't justify the extra bucks. And this way all my old lenses fit too. Soon will be taking our first trip and first opportunity to really give a work out but expect to continue to be satisfied. Is a little heavier than the Rebels but that seems to be due to the better build quality.
customer_reviews.author: Ram Man

customer_reviews.title: Canon stepping it up....
customer_reviews.text: Quite a value for the dollar. Sensor improvements. Hard to beat the 80D as a multi function tool that competes very well with the best in its price class from any manufacturer. I've written a full review on my photographic-central dot blogspot dot com website if you want in depth. If not, just take my word for it here..... this is a safe purchase in the world of DSLR cameras. Carl
customer_reviews.author: C. Garrard

customer_reviews.title: Great mid range Canon DSLR.
customer_reviews.text: This camera is great. Sure it's more expensive than the entry level DSLRs produced by Canon but the extra level of control you get with an 80D makes up for the increased cost of this camera. For example the ISO setting is more granular than what the entry level DSLRs provide and if you're shooting shutter priority it goes up to 1/8000 instead of 1/4000 that the entry level cameras do. I hope to take many, many pictures with my 80D.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing camera. I upgraded from a 2009 Rebel T1i ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing camera. I upgraded from a 2009 Rebel T1i and it is a night/day comparison. Love this new machine, my photos are turning out great.
customer_reviews.author: Ray M

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable grip, seems ergonomic to my womanly small hands, and not too heavy. I have moved up from an (old) Canon Digital Rebel XT and this is not too much more weight or expense. I am on a hobbyist level and mostly photograph animals, people, and landscapes. Fairly easy to see menu. I still need to use the manual to go through the multiple levels of the menu. Viewfinder is bright and clear. Auto focus is very fast. Swiveling touchscreen is a great asset. This is a really versatile Canon camera that produces great images for me without working very hard. Very enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: Corglet

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS CAMERA!
customer_reviews.text: WOW! Didn't realize how "slow" my 60D was until it quit working and it was going to cost me more to get it repaired than what I paid for it. This 80D is amazing! Still need to learn how to really use this camera
customer_reviews.author: tarheelrn

customer_reviews.title: Articulating screen is very useful.
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace my Canon 60D that was nearing the end of its life. I looked at the 80D and the 7D Mark ll. The deciding factor for me was the articulating LCD screen which I found very useful on the 60D. It is a great feature when shooting low or very high. Staying with a crop sensor was an investment choice for me since I have already invested in crop lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Larson

customer_reviews.title: which I dearly loved. So far I'm very pleased with the camera
customer_reviews.text: I've used Canon products for years, traded up from the 60d, which I dearly loved. So far I'm very pleased with the camera. Photos are very sharp, meter seems to handle all sorts of challenging situations very well. Seems like a significant upgrade from the 60d.
customer_reviews.author: L. S. Reed

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Good stuff! Works very well! This camera has a lot of features that digital cameras normally don't have and film cameras always did. I love it! Probably the last camera I will buy for the next 7 years.
customer_reviews.author: Preston Pettit

customer_reviews.title: Love the camera
customer_reviews.text: Love the camera. Works great. I am a retired pro, and this would've suited every need I had at wedding and portrait shoots. As with all my Canon cameras, image quality is great with L series lenses. Arguably as sharp and excellent contrast as the Ziess glass I used with my 'Blads back in the old film days
customer_reviews.author: MichelleC

customer_reviews.title: Solid camera for photos and videos - 5 stars!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this Canon EOS 80D! I am a novice when it comes to cameras and photography. I wanted to start with a camera that would grow with me as I become more experienced. The onscreen guide/tutorial is a big help. I love the versatility of the buttons and options...nothing hidden. I appreciate the comfortable hand grip and the light weight of the 80D. The AF feature is outstanding! I plan on doing YouTube videos and the AF is the reason I chose this over the 70D. I have not been disappointed. Canon's customer support is OUTSTANDING!!! They have helped me out tremendously!!!
customer_reviews.author: Erin K.

customer_reviews.title: Lots of manual override but great automatic functions.
customer_reviews.text: As usual, Canon has another great camera for advanced amateurs that has plenty of features and lots of control. Very pleased with low noise and color rendition. 5th Canon digital (after 5 film cameras that all still work).
customer_reviews.author: Fire Chief 17

customer_reviews.title: Great DSLR for HD video
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic intermediate level DSLR, especially for video. We use this camera in our church for medium and close up shots of speaker for live streaming to Facebook via a wireless remote product called Sling Studio. Slap a nice piece of glass (I use 17-55mm 2.8) on the 80D and you can produce near-cinema quality images.
customer_reviews.author: J. Edward

customer_reviews.title: Good Camera
customer_reviews.text: I upgrade form a Rebel T3i to the 80D , and it has been great so far, it functions better than I expected and is a Great improvement from my Rebel T3i in Every way especially low light ....I love it but based on its performance I'm wondering if i should have gone full frame with the 6d markii for even more low light performance.... but in any case the 80d is a great camera with great features and good image quality for those looking to upgrade from a Rebel .
customer_reviews.author: Nan

customer_reviews.title: Flip out screen is a MUST. Phenomenal camera to EASE you into FULL FRAME. + 60fps 1080p = JOY
customer_reviews.text: This is a KILLER camera for an aspiring professional photographer or an active hobbyist. The flip out screen is a must have. Feels much closer to the size/weight of a full frame than my previous crop sensor (Canon SL1 aka 100d). Tons of great and useful features and buttons. A fully charged battery can get me over halfway through a 12 hour day of shooting photos. Feels well built and solid. Battery grip can be purchased for this camera. Two cool features: Program buttons to have different actions. Great 60fps video as a cherry on top.
customer_reviews.author: Alan W Yalch

customer_reviews.title: Would Buy This Again if I Had Tons of Money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this used for $750 from a smaller seller on here and it was in near-perfect condition and came with a cheaper memory card. This camera is the best if you want a good balance between picture and video quality in my opinion. Pair this camera with the 50mm lens and you'll have some stunning results in both pictures and videos!
customer_reviews.author: Nolan B.

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my gear setup
customer_reviews.text: Amazing camera to use for wildlife, landscape, and sport subjects. Build quality is great, layout of buttons/dials is exactly right. Interface may be a little challenging, but time with camera will make it very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but Loaded for Bear
customer_reviews.text: Great versatility. Manual focus includes ultra closeup for taking photos of artworks, etc. Multiple exposure features works great, but you must use in P mode only. User manual is a bit small but pocket size for field reference.
customer_reviews.author: Albarelli

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: So glad I treated myself to this camera. I like everything about it especially the articulating monitor with touchscreen (do yourself a favor & purchase the glass screen protector).
customer_reviews.author: tmcards

customer_reviews.title: Great intermediate camera.
customer_reviews.text: Was on the verge of getting the black magic pocket cinema 4k but as the preorder was going to take quite a while I decided to pick this up. and amazingly it is still worth it. The dual autofocus, is unbeatable.
customer_reviews.author: Widlu Dieujuste

customer_reviews.title: The 80D is a Winner
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera way more than I should. I own 7D's, 70D's, C100's, XC15's and there's just something about this camera that makes me keep using it. Maybe it's the 60p 1080p slow motion, the great DPA, the ability to change lenses in such a small form factor (too far invested in Canon glass to change to other manufacturers). I can use this on a Zhiyun Crane with a stabilized lens and get phenomenal results. The dynamic range in photos has been really good too. I really do love this camera. Can't beat it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: VinC710Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Canon Quality
customer_reviews.text: Big upgrade from my old Canon 30D in terms of low light (high ISO) image quality. Only disappointment is there’s no PC cord input for off-camera flash. But I shoot wireless 80% of the time so it’s a minor inconvenience not having the “wired” capability. Can resolve the issue with a $20 hot shoe adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Reardan

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the performance and features of this camera. Would love to have a full frame camera but budget won't allow it. Besides, I have a 60 D and a T2i, so I would have to upgrade all my lenses. The features are great..I love the touch screen. I am very happy with the noise level at high ISO although It's not as good as the 5D Mark 3 or 4 It does what I need as a Portrait and Wedding Photographer.. DO NOT be fooled by any price that is too good to be true because it is not the same camera or same warranty.
customer_reviews.author: J. GaglianoTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Smooth purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I truly appreciated that when I received this product, it was in complete working order and also exactly what was specified on the product description. I had just had a terrible experience and returned my previous purchase because when I received it, not only did it have rust on vital parts of the camera, but it didn't even turn on. Thank you for being honest and I am super stoked to enjoy my product that came with NEXT DAY shipping!
customer_reviews.author: Savanna

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded to compliment my 70D. The 80D is pulling duty on my 600mm Sigma lens attm. Great camera no issues thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Rick L

customer_reviews.title: Excellent stuff
customer_reviews.text: I am a big fan of Cannon.I have had Canon 5D for years . Nothing wrong with my canon 5D but I figured that its time for new one and I love it Much more lighter to carry.I only bought a body because I have lens EF 24-105mm f/4L
customer_reviews.author: Luna

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera body
customer_reviews.text: I have owned many Canon DSLR cameras over the years and I loved this one so much that I sold my 1D X. Lightweight, great image quality, fast focus acquisition, great high ISO image quality...really good tracking for BIF. I could go on and on. Mated up with the 100-400 Mk II it's a killer combo. I shoot with friends that have the "pro" bodies and long prime lenses (like I used to) and find that I get just as good if not better shots than they do.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Basterson

customer_reviews.title: Great step up from the rebel line of canon cameras.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this camera for about 6 months now. This is a quality camera, and was well worth the price. All of my old canon lenses work great with it. Anyone who is already invested in the canon eos eco-system will be satisfied with the 80 D.
customer_reviews.author: Kappy

customer_reviews.title: perfect for vloggers
customer_reviews.text: after killing my t6i this was a must purchase and i can't be happier... love this camera... i would just get the body and spend the money on the anon 10-18mm lens if you are a youtuber or planing to make youtube videos like i do;-)
customer_reviews.author: YUSUF ONDER

customer_reviews.title: My AE-1 would be proud....
customer_reviews.text: Always liked Canon sense owning an AE-1 many years ago. This 80D brings back memories. Love the fact that I can customize almost every feature. Great looking pics and videos. Manual mode rocks. Going to LOVE this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: Huge improvement over 70D
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. I've the 70D. No comparison . I use the 80D for work and rely on the autofocus in moderate light . Focus is super fast and accurate . 70D is junk by comparison although you would not get this opinion by just looking at camera specs that all say incremental upgrade .
customer_reviews.author: Jerry A

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite.
customer_reviews.text: Battery works very long. The first time I used it to take action shots, I was amazed how many more great shots I got, and in focus. I got this mainly for its video recording. Has a really good follow focus.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Kaiser

customer_reviews.title: This camera is perfect! It's focuses quickly
customer_reviews.text: This camera is perfect! It's focuses quickly, functions smoothly and is not the heavy. I love having the 45 focus points! My images are turning out better than when I had my SL1! Love love love this camera!!
customer_reviews.author: Alyse McGiboney

customer_reviews.title: Great for Vlogging and Timelapses.
customer_reviews.text: The Canon 80D has great autofocus. Too bad it doesn't do 4K. I would highly recommend it for professional vloggers and people looking to create timelapses straight into video.
customer_reviews.author: Derrick

customer_reviews.title: great for wildlife photos
customer_reviews.text: I use my camera for taking pictures of wildlife. It has quite a few bells and whistles which I like. A beginner could use it on Auto and slow work into the other settings.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Camera I’ve ever used
customer_reviews.text: Item came exactly as described, arrived even earlier than what it was projected to. Amazing camera and seller!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: This upgrade from my Canon T6....the next one I love to have is the mark 5d mark iv
customer_reviews.author: Jhunter Group LLC

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a great investment
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I'm so happy that I invested and got this camera. The autofocus works like magic, so fast and without loud sound. The image quality is beyond phenomenal, crisp and clean pictures. I absolutely recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Olena Chek

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera. I now have 2 of them and they are great. If you are looking for an inexpensive camera that gives you high quality images then this is the one.
customer_reviews.author: R. Story

customer_reviews.title: best camera i have own coming from a xsi the ...
customer_reviews.text: best camera i have own coming from a xsi the ddifference is huge, the auto focus is lighting fast, i`m using a 17-70mm ultrasonic lens what a pair they make.
customer_reviews.author: Ruddy J. Estrella

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: Very good camera! I upgraded from my T6i to this and I am so happy that I did! Love the picture and video quality on this.
customer_reviews.author: Kenzie

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I've barely put this down since it arrived! All the added features are great to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great for starters like me.. you can consider a full frame for the price range though
customer_reviews.author: Luigui Marino

customer_reviews.title: Great Company
customer_reviews.text: I got my oder 10 days before expected. Camera is in great quality (better than stated) and I'm loving it so far. This business is family owned and makes you feel like a valued customer. They get your order to you as fast as they can. 100% would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera for video
customer_reviews.text: Great Camera for video! This is the best Canon camera for easily shooting professional looking video. I can't recommend it enough.
customer_reviews.author: Dacy Nottingham

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the 80D after using it for about one year now. Previously I had 550D, but the 80D focusing is much faster and more accurate and I take better photos as a result.
customer_reviews.author: pbsf

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for this beginner!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first camera I have purchased. I needed a good camera for sporting events and so far so good!!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay W

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for beginners and beyond.
customer_reviews.text: Great fit in the hand. Good weight. I thought the focus was a bit slow but it could be the fault of the user. I'm still getting used to baby. I have no regrets in purchasing this item.
customer_reviews.author: Norvell Brown

product_meta.title: Canon EOS 80D SLR Camera Kit with EF-S 18-55 mm IS STM Lens/16 GB SD Card and Case - Black
product_meta.description:
Size Name:18-55mm KitWith impressive speed, instinctive controls and innovative technologies, the versatile EOS 80D Wi-Fi DSLR is ideal for exploring new areas of photography and achieving the stunning results your creativity deserves.

BOX CONTAINS
EOS 80D Body Eyecup Eb Camera Cover R-F-3 Wide Strap EW-EOS 80D Battery Pack LP-E6N Battery Charger LC-E6E Power Cord 18-55mm IS STM Lens 16GB SD Card and Camera Case
feature_bullets: Excel at capturing action with a responsive 45-point cross-type AF system and 7 fps continuous shooting rate
Capture atmospheric, detailed 24.2 Megapixel images with accurate exposure metering, ISO 100-16, 000 and Flicker Detection
Intelligent Viewfinder with 100% coverage and large intuitive Vari-Angle LCD touch screen make it easy to creatively compose your shots
Shoot expert Full HD 60p movies with powerful Dual Pixel CMOS AF and full control at your fingertips
EOS 80D Body Eyecup Eb Camera Cover R-F-3 Wide Strap EW-EOS 80D Battery Pack LP-E6N Battery Charger LC-E6E Power Cord 18-55mm IS STM Lens 16GB SD Card and Camera Case
